The chain e: mail claimed that a new federal program provides subsidized "Obama phones" with 70 free minutes of cell phone service every month. This aspect of the claim was verified by researching the existence of such a program and finding that it is indeed a real program called Lifeline, administered by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC).
The e: mail claimed that the program threatens "the very foundations that this country was built on" and "the age old concepts of God, family, and hard work." This aspect of the claim was not directly verified as it is subjective and based on personal opinions rather than factual evidence.
